bibl.title: Letter from James H. Pou to Henry Rose Carter, June 23, 1915

div1.p: Pou requests an inspection of a site for a lawsuit.

div1.head: Letter from James H. Pou to Henry Rose Carter, June 23, 1915
div1.opener:
CAPITAL CITY PHONE 355
PRACTICE LIMITED TO MATTERS OF IMPORTANCE
C. A. GOSNEY, NOTARY PUBLIC,
CONVEYANCES AND DEPOSITIONS
JAMES H. POU.
LAWYER--GENERAL PRACTICE,
ROOMS 210 AND 211 TUCKER BUILDING
Raleigh, N.C., June 23rd, 1915.
Dr. H. R. Carter, Senior Surgeon,
United States Public Health Service,
Lock 12,
Clanton, Ala.
My dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
The next of the health suits likely to be
tried are by men named Ingram, who own land and live on the
east side of the pond between Mountain Creek and Coleman's
Mill. We would like to have a careful examination made of
their immediate localities as early as practicable, and if
necessary, one made later in the season; both to be made
between this time and cold weather, and the first one to be
made as soon as practicable.

It would be highly satisfactory to us if you would
undertake to make this investigation on terms similar to
those on which you made the investigation in the Smith's Creek
section on the west side of the lake. If you could secure
leave of absence from the Government to do this work, we
would consider ourselves fortunate; and we would take pleasure
in doing everything we could for your comfort and place at
your disposal every convenience practicable.

We assume that probably you would not care to make
an investigation of the entire lake; and that it would be
sufficient for you to make a careful examination of the part
of the lake contiguous to the properties in litigation and make
an examination around the plaintiffs' premises.
PRACTICE LIMITED TO MATTERS OF IMPORTANCE

JAMES H. POU.
LAWYER--GENERAL PRACTICE,
ROOMS 210 AND 211 TUCKER BUILDING
Raleigh, N.C.,

C. A. GOSNEY, NOTARY PUBLIC,
CONVEYANCES AND DEPOSITIONS

This case would be tried in Rockingham, the
County seat of Richmond County.

Hoping you can assist us, and thanking you very
much for the assistance you have heretofore rendered us, I am,
with much respect and best wishes,
